p: Several main compounds with a C6–C1 have apparently been reported up to date in S. virgaurea, two glycosides and two aglycones: virgaureoside A, a bis-desmosidic glycoside derived from benzoic acid (2-beta-D-glucopyranosyloxybenzoic acid-2′-beta-D-glucopyranosyloxybenzyl ester) [ 101], leiocarposide (2′-hydroxybenzyl-3-methoxybenzoate 2′,4-diglucoside) [ 56], vanillic acid, gallic acid [ 9, 102], benzoic acid, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid, 3,4-dihydroxybenzoic (protocatechuic) acid, and 2,5-dihydroxibenzoic (gentisic) acid [ 85, 86]. Such derivatives of the benzoic acid are often occurring in the family Asteraceae [ 103].
